intro: Bungea turkestanica, commonly known as the Turkistan bungea, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and alternate, simple, ovate leaves. The plant produces yellowish flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by distinctive, woody, spiny capsules containing several seeds. It is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting well to dry conditions with its deep root system.
